creator: Talbot, Fiona, author.$$QTalbot, Fiona
description: Annotation How to Write Effective Business English focuses on writing English for home and international business as a key business tool for native and non-native English speakers.
series: Talbot, Fiona. Better business English.$$QBetter business English.
contents: Cover; Title; Copyright; Contents; Preface; Who is this book for?; Be effective by writing content of value; How does the book work?; You may have to unlearn some things you learnt at school; Get results!; Introduction; 1 Why are you writing?; Who are your readers?; Your audience can be anyone and everyone; What's the purpose of your writing?; Readers take just a few seconds to judge your writing; No body language signals in writing; How formal or informal do you need to be?; Your checklist for action; 2 Business writing for today; Winning business through English.

Academic writing compared with writing for businessAcademic writing requirements; Business writing requirements; Can you use 'I' when you write in business?; Other things that you may wish to 'unlearn'; Listen to readers' feedback; Choosing the right style; Ideal communication; The Word Power Skills system: four easy steps to success; A guide to premier business writing; Your checklist for action; 3 Quality matters; Shine through your writing!; To make mistakes is only human?; How readers can react to written mistakes; Further costs of getting your writing wrong.

You can never fully outsource your writingChecking for mistakes; Proofreading tips; Your checklist for action; 4 Telling your story through social media; There's a new type of business writing; Get into the social media mindset; More about social media; What are the key objectives?; Some major platforms out there; How do companies shine through their social media interaction?; Writing that creates trust can create a community; The long and the short of it: past, present and future; Further writing tips for key channels such as Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn; Facebook; Twitter.

Newsletters, blogs, vlogs or micro-blog postsLinkedIn and SlideShare; What excites people so much they want to share it?; Call people to action -- and check it's worked; Tips for writing calls to action; Your social media posts need to cross-refer to your website; Telling your story; Your checklist for action; 5 Defining business English; 'Standard' and 'variant' English; Writing for both native and non-native English speakers; Some surprising problems with English for global business; Define business English within your company; Your checklist for action; 6 Writing English for global business.

Looking at how you use English at workDo your words say what you think they say?; Writing problems faced by non-native English writers; Use plain English when you can; Problems with non-native English writing for native English speakers; Problems posed for native and non-native English writers alike; Idioms, clichés and nuances; Standard and online dictionaries, and the lure of cut and paste; Business writing as communication; English continues to evolve; Non-native English writers can have an advantage!; Native English writers: beware of complacency!; Your checklist for action.
